* Isamaa: "A Secure Estonia"
* Estonian Greens: "A Green Estonia"
* Estonian Free Party: "A Free Estonia"
* United Left Party: "A Just Estonia"

# Campaign

The campaign for the 2023 Estonian parliamentary election began in January 2023 and lasted for six weeks.

## Issues

The key issues in the campaign included:

* The economy: The parties debated the best way to stimulate economic growth and reduce unemployment.
* Healthcare: The parties discussed the need to improve the healthcare system and reduce waiting times.
* Education: The parties debated the need to improve the education system and increase funding for schools.
* National security: The parties discussed the need to improve national security and defense spending.

## Debates

A number of debates were held during the campaign, including a televised debate between the leaders of the main parties.

# Opinion Polls

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign to gauge public opinion.

# Results

The results of the election were as follows:

* Reform Party: 31.2% of the vote, 33 seats
* Centre Party: 23.1% of the vote, 24 seats
* Conservative People's Party: 17.1% of the vote, 17 seats
* Estonia 200: 13.3% of the vote, 14 seats
* Social Democratic Party: 9.3% of the vote, 9 seats

* Estonian Greens: 5.3% of the vote, 5 seats
* Estonian Free Party: 4.2% of the vote, 0 seats
* United Left Party: 3.3% of the vote, 0 seats

## Results by Constituency

The results by constituency were as follows:

* Haabersti, Põhja-Tallinn, and Kristiine: Reform Party 34.6%, Centre Party 26.3%
* Kesklinn, Lasnamäe, and Pirita: Centre Party 30.5%, Reform Party 26.9%

* Jõgeva and Tartu: Reform Party 32.5%, Centre Party 25.3%
* Tartu: Reform Party 35.2%, Centre Party 23.5%
* Valga: Centre Party 29.5%, Reform Party 25.1%
* Võru, Põlva, and Jõgeva: Centre Party 30.3%, Reform Party 25.5%
* Ida-Viru: Centre Party 35.6%, Reform Party 23.2%

# Aftermath

The election resulted in a hung parliament, with no party having a majority of seats.

## Government Formation

article:
Lil Keed
================

Raqhid Jevon Render, professionally known as Lil Keed, was an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. He was a member of Young Stoner Life Records, the record label founded by Young Thug, and was affiliated with the YSL collective.

Early Life
------------

Lil Keed was born on March 16, 1998, in Atlanta, Georgia. He grew up in a low-income household with six siblings, and his family often struggled to make ends meet. Keed's early life was marked by poverty and violence, which would later influence his music. He began rapping in his teenage years, inspired by artists such as Lil Wayne and T.I.

Career
--------

### 2018: Trapped on Cleveland 2 and Keed Talk To 'Em

Lil Keed's music career began to take off in 2018, when he released his mixtape "Trapped on Cleveland 2". The project gained traction on social media platforms and caught the attention of Young Thug, who eventually signed Keed to his record label, Young Stoner Life Records. Later that year, Keed released "Keed Talk To 'Em", a mixtape that further solidified his reputation as a rising star in the Atlanta hip-hop scene.

### 2019: Long Live Mexico

In 2019, Lil Keed released his debut studio album, "Long Live Mexico". The album was a tribute to his friend and fellow rapper, Mexico, who had passed away in 2018. "Long Live Mexico" featured guest appearances from artists such as Young Thug, Gunna, and Nav, and received positive reviews from critics.

### 2020: Trapped on Cleveland 3

In 2020, Lil Keed released his second studio album, "Trapped on Cleveland 3". The album was a commercial success, debuting at number 42 on the US Billboard 200 chart. "Trapped on Cleveland 3" featured guest appearances from artists such as Travis Scott, Young Thug, and Chris Brown.

### 2023: Keed Talk to 'Em 2

In 2023, Lil Keed released his third studio album, "Keed Talk to 'Em 2". The album was a sequel to his 2018 mixtape "Keed Talk To 'Em", and featured guest appearances from artists such as Nav, Lil Baby, and Young Thug.

Musical Styles
----------------

Lil Keed's music is characterized by his melodic flow and introspective lyrics. He often raps about his experiences growing up in poverty and his struggles with violence and trauma.

### Influences

Lil Keed's music is influenced by a range of artists, including Lil Wayne, T.I., and Young Thug. He has also cited drill rappers such as Chief Keef and Lil Durk as influences.

Live Performances
------------------

Lil Keed was known for his high-energy live performances, which often featured him performing his hits such as "Nameless" and "Snake". He toured extensively throughout his career, performing at festivals such as Rolling Loud and Governors Ball.

Death
------

Lil Keed passed away on May 13, 2022, at the age of 24. The cause of death was not publicly disclosed.

Discography

### Mixtapes

### Other Charted Songs

The 2023 Copa Perú is the 51st edition of the Copa Perú, the fifth tier of Peruvian football. The tournament started on April 15, 2023, and will conclude on November 12, 2023. This edition will feature a total of 297 teams from all 24 departments of Peru, as well as the Constitutional Province of Callao.

# Departmental stage

The departmental stage is the first round of the tournament, where teams from each department compete against each other to determine the departmental champions. This stage started on April 15, 2023, and concluded on June 4, 2023. The top teams from each department advanced to the national stage.

In this stage, teams played a series of matches against each other, with the team earning the most points declared the departmental champion. In the event of a tie, a playoff match was played to determine the champion. The departmental stage saw several surprises, with some favorite teams failing to advance to the national stage.

# National Stage

The national stage is the second round of the tournament, where the departmental champions compete against each other to determine the national champion. This stage started on June 11, 2023, and concluded on October 8, 2023.

## League table

article:
Gonzalo Lira

Gonzalo Lira is a Chilean-American filmmaker, writer, and former blogger who gained international attention for his coverage of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. His work as a war correspondent and commentator on the conflict in Ukraine has been widely followed and debated.

#Early life

Gonzalo Lira was born in 1968 in Santiago, Chile. He spent his early years in Chile before moving to the United States with his family at a young age. Lira grew up in the United States, where he developed an interest in filmmaking and writing. He pursued his passion for storytelling through education, attending film school and honing his craft as a writer and director.

##Education and influences

Lira's educational background in filmmaking and writing had a significant impact on his future career. His interest in storytelling and his ability to craft compelling narratives would later serve him well in his work as a war correspondent and commentator. Lira has cited various influences on his work, including his experiences growing up as a Chilean-American and his interest in international politics and conflict.

#Career

Gonzalo Lira began his career as a filmmaker and writer, working on various projects in the United States and abroad. His early work focused on fiction filmmaking, and he wrote and directed several short films and feature-length projects. However, Lira's career took a significant turn when he began to focus on non-fiction work, particularly in the area of war correspondence.

##War correspondence

Lira's work as a war correspondent began in earnest during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. He traveled to Ukraine and began to report on the conflict, using his skills as a filmmaker and writer to document the war and its impact on civilians. Lira's reports from Ukraine were widely followed, and he quickly gained a reputation as a knowledgeable and fearless commentator on the conflict.

##Blogging and social media

In addition to his work as a war correspondent, Lira has also maintained a presence as a blogger and social media personality. He has written extensively on international politics and conflict, and has used social media platforms to share his thoughts and analysis with a wider audience. Lira's blogging and social media work has been widely followed, and he has become known for his incisive commentary and analysis.

#Arrest and prosecution

In March 2022, Lira was arrested by Ukrainian authorities while reporting on the conflict in Ukraine. He was charged with spreading pro-Russian propaganda, and was held in detention for several weeks. Lira's arrest and prosecution were widely reported, and sparked controversy among journalists and human rights groups.

##Detention and trial

Lira was held in detention for several weeks before being released on bail. He faced trial on charges of spreading pro-Russian propaganda, and was ultimately convicted and sentenced to several years in prison. Lira's detention and trial were widely criticized by human rights groups and journalists, who argued that he was being targeted for his critical reporting on the Ukrainian government.

#Death

Gonzalo Lira was reported missing in April 2022, and was later confirmed to have died while in Ukrainian custody. The circumstances of his death are still unclear, and have been the subject of controversy and speculation. Lira's death was widely reported, and sparked an outpouring of tributes and condolences from journalists and human rights groups.

#Filmography

Gonzalo Lira's filmography includes several short films and feature-length projects, both fiction and non-fiction. Some of his notable works include:

* "The American Dream" (2005)
* "The End of the World as We Know It" (2008)
* "Ukraine: The Hidden War" (2022)

#Publications

In addition to his filmmaking and blogging work, Lira has also written for several publications, including:

* "The Guardian"
* "The New York Times"
* "The Nation"

article:
Testate Succession in South African Law

Testate succession in South African law refers to the process by which a person's estate is distributed according to their will after their death. The law governing testate succession in South Africa is primarily codified in the Wills Act 7 of 1953 and the Administration of Estates Act 66 of 1965. This article provides an overview of the key principles and rules governing testate succession in South African law.

# Freedom of Testation

Freedom of testation is the principle that a person has the right to dispose of their property as they wish after their death, subject to certain limitations. This principle is enshrined in the South African Constitution, which guarantees the right to property and the right to freedom of testation.

## Limitations

While the principle of freedom of testation is fundamental to South African law, there are certain limitations on a person's ability to dispose of their property as they wish. These limitations include:

### Illegal Dispositions and Those Against Public Policy

A person cannot dispose of their property in a way that is illegal or contrary to public policy. For example, a person cannot leave their property to someone who is not entitled to inherit it, such as an illegitimate child who is not recognized by the law.

### Subdivision of Agricultural Land

The Subdivision of Agricultural Land Act 70 of 1970 prohibits the subdivision of agricultural land into smaller portions, except in certain circumstances. This means that a person cannot leave their agricultural land to multiple beneficiaries in a way that would result in the land being subdivided.

### Subdivision of Mineral Rights

The Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act 28 of 2002 regulates the subdivision of mineral rights. A person cannot leave their mineral rights to multiple beneficiaries in a way that would result in the rights being subdivided, except in certain circumstances.

### Fideicommissum Multiplex

A fideicommissum multiplex is a type of trust where a person leaves their property to multiple beneficiaries, with each beneficiary having a successive interest in the property. South African law does not recognize fideicommissa multiplex, and any attempt to create such a trust will be invalid.

### Maintenance of Surviving Spouse

A person's surviving spouse has a right to maintenance from the estate, and this right takes priority over any other claims against the estate. A person cannot dispose of their property in a way that would deprive their surviving spouse of this right.

### Maintenance and Education of Minor Children

A person's minor children have a right to maintenance and education from the estate, and this right takes priority over any other claims against the estate. A person cannot dispose of their property in a way that would deprive their minor children of this right.

### Pension Funds

Pension funds are regulated by the Pension Funds Act 24 of 1956, and a person cannot dispose of their pension benefits in a way that would contravene this Act.

## Delegation

A person can delegate their power to dispose of their property to another person, such as a trustee or executor. However, this delegation must be done in accordance with the law, and the delegate must act in accordance with the person's wishes as expressed in their will.

## Customary Law

Customary law plays an important role in South African law, particularly in relation to the rights of indigenous people. A person who is subject to customary law may have different rights and obligations in relation to the disposal of their property, and these rights and obligations must be taken into account when interpreting their will.

# Testamentary Capacity

Testamentary capacity refers to a person's mental ability to make a valid will. A person must have the necessary mental capacity to understand the nature and extent of their property, as well as the consequences of their decisions.

## Mental Ability of the Testator

A person must have the necessary mental ability to make a valid will, which includes the ability to understand the nature and extent of their property, as well as the consequences of their decisions. A person who is mentally incapacitated, such as someone who is suffering from dementia, may not have the necessary mental ability to make a valid will.

## Undue Influence on the Testator

A person's will can be invalid if it is made as a result of undue influence. Undue influence occurs when someone uses coercion or manipulation to influence a person's decisions, and this can include threats, intimidation, or manipulation.

# Capacity to Witness a Will

A person who witnesses a will must have the necessary mental capacity to understand the nature and extent of the will, as well as the consequences of their actions. A person who is mentally incapacitated, such as someone who is suffering from dementia, may not have the necessary mental capacity to witness a will.

# Formalities for Execution of a Will

A will must be executed in accordance with the formalities prescribed by law, which includes the requirement that the will be in writing, signed by the testator, and witnessed by two or more competent witnesses.

## Requirements for a Testamentary Disposition

A testamentary disposition must be made in accordance with the formalities prescribed by law, which includes the requirement that the disposition be in writing, signed by the testator, and witnessed by two or more competent witnesses.

## Methods of Executing a Valid Will

There are several methods of executing a valid will, including:

* Signing the will in the presence of two or more competent witnesses
* Signing the will in the presence of a notary public
* Signing the will in the presence of a commissioner of oaths

## Signing and Signature

The testator must sign the will in the presence of two or more competent witnesses, and the witnesses must sign the will in the presence of the testator. The signature must be made by the testator themselves, and not by someone else on their behalf.

## Certificate

A certificate of execution must be attached to the will, which includes the signatures of the witnesses and a statement that the will was executed in accordance with the formalities prescribed by law.

## Witnesses

Two or more competent witnesses are required to witness a will, and the witnesses must sign the will in the presence of the testator. The witnesses must be competent, which means that they must have the necessary mental capacity to understand the nature and extent of the will, as well as the consequences of their actions.

# Condonation

Condonation is the process by which a court can validate a will that does not comply with the formalities prescribed by law. Condonation can be granted if the court is satisfied that the will was made in accordance with the testator's wishes, and that the formalities were not complied with due to a genuine mistake or oversight.

# Invalid Wills

A will can be invalid if it does not comply with the formalities prescribed by law, or if it is made as a result of undue influence or mental incapacity.

## Revocation

A will can be revoked by the testator at any time, either by making a new will or by destroying the existing will.

### Right of Revocation

The testator has the right to revoke their will at any time, either by making a new will or by destroying the existing will.

### Manner

A will can be revoked in several ways, including:

* Making a new will
* Destroying the existing will
* Ademption
* Other means of revocation

#### Later Will or Codicil

A later will or codicil can revoke an earlier will, either in whole or in part.

#### Physical or Symbolic Destruction

A will can be revoked by physically or symbolically destroying it, such as by tearing it up or burning it.

#### Ademption

Ademption occurs when a specific gift in a will is revoked due to the testator's subsequent actions, such as selling the property or giving it away.

#### Other Means of Revocation

A will can be revoked by other means, such as by a court order or by the testator's subsequent marriage or divorce.

#### Divorce or Annulment of Marriage

A will can be revoked by the divorce or annulment of the testator's marriage, either in whole or in part.

### Exceptions to the General Rule that a Will Can Be Revoked

There are several exceptions to the general rule that a will can be revoked, including:

* A will that is made in contemplation of marriage
* A will that is made in anticipation of a specific event, such as a business deal

### Revival of a Revoked Will

A revoked will can be revived if the testator makes a new will that revives the earlier will, either in whole or in part.

## Alteration or Variation

A will can be altered or varied by the testator, either by making a new will or by adding a codicil.

### Amendment by Testator

A will can be amended by the testator, either by making a new will or by adding a codicil.

### Rectification by Court

A will can be rectified by a court, either by correcting errors or ambiguities in the will, or by adding omitted provisions.

### Alteration or Variation by the Court

A will can be altered or varied by a court, either by correcting errors or ambiguities in the will, or by adding omitted provisions.

## Incorporation by Reference

A will can incorporate other documents by reference, such as a trust deed or a contract.

# Obsolete and Provincial Wills

Obsolete and provincial wills are wills that were made before the current laws came into effect, or that were made in a different province or country.

# Joint or Mutual Wills

Joint or mutual wills are wills that are made by two or more people, either jointly or severally.

# Probate of Wills

Probate is the process by which a court validates a will and appoints an executor to administer the estate.

## Lost Wills

A lost will can be proved by a court, either by producing a copy of the will or by evidence of the testator's intentions.

# Content of Wills

A will can contain a variety of provisions, including:

* Inheritance and legacy
* Prior and legal rights
* Vested, conditional and future interests

## Inheritance and Legacy

A will can provide for the inheritance and legacy of specific property, either to individuals or to organizations.

## Prior and Legal Rights

A will can provide for the prior and legal rights of specific individuals or organizations, such as a spouse or children.

## Vested, Conditional and Future Interests

A will can provide for vested, conditional and future interests in property, either to individuals or to organizations.

## Vested Interests

Vested interests are interests in property that are fixed and certain, either as to the amount or as to the timing.

## Conditional Interests

Conditional interests are interests in property that are subject to certain conditions or events, such as the testator's death or the beneficiary's marriage.

### Future Interests

Future interests are interests in property that will take effect at a future time, either as to the amount or as to the timing.

### Valid and Invalid Conditions

Conditions in a will can be valid or invalid, depending on whether they are reasonable and enforceable.

## Nudum Praeceptum

A nudum praeceptum is a bare request or wish in a will, without any specific provision or direction.

## Estate Massing

Estate massing is the process by which a court can combine multiple estates, either to simplify administration or to achieve a specific goal.

## Customary Law

Customary law plays an important role in South African law, particularly in relation to the rights of indigenous people.

## Testamentary Devices

Testamentary devices are legal mechanisms used in wills to achieve specific goals or outcomes, such as:

* Usufruct
* Substitution
* Trust

### Usufruct

Usufruct is the right to use and enjoy property, either for a specific period or for life.

### Substitution

Substitution is the process by which one beneficiary is replaced by another, either in whole or in part.

#### Direct Substitution

Direct substitution occurs when one beneficiary is replaced by another, either by name or by description.

#### Fideicommissary Substitution

Fideicommissary substitution occurs when one beneficiary is replaced by another, either by name or by description, with the substitution taking effect at a future time.

### Difference between Usufruct and Fideicommissum

Usufruct and fideicommissum are both testamentary devices, but they serve different purposes and have different effects.

### Fideicommissum Residui

Fideicommissum residui is a type of fideicommissum that takes effect after the death of the first beneficiary.

### Fideicommissum Purum

Fideicommissum purum is a type of fideicommissum that takes effect immediately after the death of the testator.

### Trust

A trust is a legal mechanism used to manage property for the benefit of one or more beneficiaries.

## Bequests Subject to a Modus

Bequests in a will can be subject to a modus, either to achieve a specific goal or to avoid a particular outcome.

## Interpretation of Some Common Dispositions in Wills

Common dispositions in wills can be interpreted in different ways, depending on the context and the language used.

### Presumption against Fideicommissa

There is a presumption against fideicommissa in South African law, which means that a court will not interpret a will as creating a fideicommissum unless the language is clear and unambiguous.

### Si Sine Liberis Decesserit Clause

A si sine liberis decesserit clause is a provision in a will that takes effect if the beneficiary dies without children.

## Implied Fideicommissa

Implied fideicommissa can arise in certain circumstances, such as:

* Fideicommissum subject to a si sine liberis condition
* Prohibitions against alienation

### Fideicommissum Subject to a Si Sine Liberis Condition

A fideicommissum subject to a si sine liberis condition takes effect if the beneficiary dies without children.

### Prohibitions against Alienation

Prohibitions against alienation can create an implied fideicommissum, either to achieve a specific goal or to avoid a particular outcome.

## Statutory Aids to Interpretation

Statutory aids to interpretation can assist a court in interpreting a will, either to clarify ambiguous language or to achieve a specific goal.

## Combinations of Various Interests

Combinations of various interests can be used in a will to achieve specific goals or outcomes, such as:

* Fideicommissum upon fideicommissum
* Compendiosa substitutio
* Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the usufruct at the testator’s death

### Fideicommissum upon Fideicommissum

A fideicommissum upon fideicommissum takes effect after the death of the first beneficiary.

### Compendiosa Substitutio

Compendiosa substitutio is a type of substitution that takes effect immediately after the death of the testator.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct with a Direct Substitution as to the Usufruct at the Testator’s Death

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the usufruct at the testator’s death takes effect after the death of the testator.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct as to Which There is a Fideicommissary Substitution

Ownership subject to a usufruct as to which there is a fideicommissary substitution takes effect after the death of the first beneficiary.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct with a Direct Substitution as to the Ownership at the Testator’s Death

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the ownership at the testator’s death takes effect after the death of the testator.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct with a Direct Substitution as to the Ownership at the Death of the Usufructuary

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the ownership at the death of the usufructuary takes effect after the death of the usufructuary.

### Fideicommissum in Which One Fideicommissary is Directly Substituted for Another

Fideicommissum in which one fideicommissary is directly substituted for another takes effect immediately after the death of the testator.

# Effect of Wills

A will can have significant effects on the distribution of property, either during the testator’s lifetime or after their death.

## Rights of Heirs

Heirs have certain rights under a will, either to inherit specific property or to receive a share of the residue.

## Rights of Legatees

Legatees have certain rights under a will, either to receive a specific gift or to inherit a share of the residue.

### Abatement of Legacies

Legacies can abate, either in whole or in part, if the testator’s estate is insufficient to pay all of the legacies.

## Rights of Fiduciaries and Fideicommissaries

Fiduciaries and fideicommissaries have certain rights and obligations under a will, either to manage property or to distribute it to beneficiaries.

## Ius Accrescendi

Ius accrescendi is the right of a beneficiary to receive a greater share of property if another beneficiary dies or is disqualified.

### Express Provision Concerning Accrual

An express provision concerning accrual can be included in a will, either to specify how accrual will occur or to exclude it altogether.

### No Provision Concerning Accrual

If there is no provision concerning accrual in a will, the court will apply the default rules to determine how accrual will occur.

article:
2022 Philippine Presidential Election

The 2022 Philippine presidential election was the 17th presidential election in the Philippines since the establishment of the Third Republic in 1946. The election was held on May 9, 2022, to elect the president and vice president of the Philippines, as well as members of the House of Representatives and the Senate.

#Background

The presidential election was held amidst a backdrop of significant economic, social, and political challenges facing the Philippines. The country was still reeling from the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, which had caused widespread disruption to the economy and public health. Additionally, issues such as corruption, poverty, and climate change were major concerns for voters.

The election also saw the participation of several high-profile candidates, including the son of former President Ferdinand Marcos, Bongbong Marcos, and the incumbent vice president, Leni Robredo. The campaign period was marked by intense politicking and debate, with candidates vying for the attention of voters.

#Electoral System

The Philippines uses a plurality voting system to elect its president and vice president. Under this system, the candidate with the most votes wins the election. The country is divided into 81 provinces, each with its own set of congressional districts. Voters cast separate ballots for president, vice president, members of the House of Representatives, and members of the Senate.

#Candidates

##Ernesto Abella (Independent)

Ernesto Abella is a journalist and politician who served as the presidential spokesperson under President Rodrigo Duterte. He ran as an independent candidate, focusing on issues such as corruption and good governance.

##Leody de Guzman (PLM)

Leody de Guzman is a labor leader and politician who has been involved in various social and economic causes. He is the chairman of the Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino (BMP) and ran for president under the Partido Lakas ng Masa (PLM).

###Walden Bello (PLM)

Walden Bello is a sociologist and politician who served as a member of the House of Representatives. He ran as De Guzman's running mate under the PLM.

##Norberto Gonzales (PDSP)

Norberto Gonzales is a politician who has held various positions, including secretary of national defense and secretary of the interior and local government. He ran for president under the Partido Demokratiko Sosyalista ng Pilipinas (PDSP).

##Panfilo Lacson (Independent)

Panfilo Lacson is a politician and former chief of the Philippine National Police. He ran as an independent candidate, focusing on issues such as corruption and crime.

###Tito Sotto (NPC)

Tito Sotto is a musician and politician who has served as a member of the Senate. He ran as Lacson's running mate under the Nationalist People's Coalition (NPC).

##Faisal Mangondato (Katipunan)

Faisal Mangondato is a businessman and politician who has been involved in various social and economic causes. He ran for president under the Katipunan ng Kamalayang Kayumanggi (Katipunan).

###Carlos Serapio (Katipunan)

Carlos Serapio is a politician who ran as Mangondato's running mate under the Katipunan.

##Bongbong Marcos (PFP)

Bongbong Marcos is a politician and the son of former President Ferdinand Marcos. He ran for president under the Partido Federal ng Pilipinas (PFP).

###Sara Duterte (Lakas)

Sara Duterte is a politician and the daughter of President Rodrigo Duterte. She ran as Marcos's running mate under the Lakas-Christian Muslim Democrats (Lakas).

##Jose Montemayor Jr. (DPP)

Jose Montemayor Jr. is a politician who has held various positions, including secretary of the interior and local government. He ran for president under the Democratic Party of the Philippines (DPP).

###Rizalito David (DPP)

Rizalito David is a politician who ran as Montemayor's running mate under the DPP.

##Isko Moreno (Aksyon)

Isko Moreno is a politician who has served as the mayor of Manila. He ran for president under the Aksyon Demokratiko (Aksyon).

###Willie Ong (Aksyon)

Willie Ong is a doctor and politician who ran as Moreno's running mate under the Aksyon.

##Manny Pacquiao (PROMDI)

Manny Pacquiao is a boxer and politician who has served as a member of the House of Representatives. He ran for president under the Progressive Movement for the Devolution of Initiatives (PROMDI).

###Lito Atienza (PROMDI)

Lito Atienza is a politician who ran as Pacquiao's running mate under the PROMDI.

##Leni Robredo (Independent)

Leni Robredo is a politician and the incumbent vice president. She ran as an independent candidate, focusing on issues such as corruption and good governance.

###Francis Pangilinan (Liberal)

Francis Pangilinan is a politician who has served as a member of the Senate. He ran as Robredo's running mate under the Liberal Party.

##Standalone vice presidential candidate

###Manny Lopez (WPP)

Manny Lopez is a politician who ran as a standalone candidate for vice president under the Workers and Peasants Party (WPP).

#Debates and Forums

##Presidential debates and forums

Several presidential debates and forums were held during the campaign period. These events allowed candidates to present their platforms and answer questions from the public.

##Vice presidential debates

Several vice presidential debates were also held, allowing candidates to present their platforms and answer questions from the public.

#Opinion Polling

##For president

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign period to gauge public support for the candidates. Marcos and Robredo consistently topped the polls, with Marcos maintaining a significant lead.

##For vice president

Opinion polls were also conducted for the vice presidential election. Duterte and Pangilinan consistently topped the polls, with Duterte maintaining a significant lead.

#Campaign

##Issues

The campaign period saw a focus on various issues, including corruption, poverty, and climate change. Candidates also debated on issues such as the COVID-19 pandemic and the country's economic recovery.

##Start of campaign period for national positions

The campaign period for national positions began on February 8, 2022. Candidates began campaigning across the country, presenting their platforms and meeting with voters.

##Start of campaign period for local positions

The campaign period for local positions began on March 25, 2022. Candidates for local positions began campaigning, presenting their platforms and meeting with voters.

##Miting de avance

The final campaign rallies, known as the "miting de avance," were held on May 7, 2022. Candidates held large rallies across the country, urging voters to support them.

#Results

##For president

The Commission on Elections (COMELEC) began counting votes on May 9, 2022. Marcos was declared the winner, receiving over 31 million votes.

###Result by island group and region

Marcos won in all island groups and regions, except for the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao, where Robredo won.

##For vice president

The COMELEC also began counting votes for the vice presidential election. Duterte was declared the winner, receiving over 32 million votes.

###Result by island group and region

Duterte won in all island groups and regions.

##Results per province, city, diplomatic post and absentee voting category

The COMELEC released the results per province, city, diplomatic post, and absentee voting category. Marcos and Duterte won in most areas.

###Close places

There were several close places, including the province of Quezon, where Robredo won by a margin of less than 1%.

###Landslides

Marcos and Duterte won by landslide margins in several areas, including the province of Ilocos Norte, where Marcos won by over 90%.

###Swing in Vote Share

There was a significant swing in vote share in several areas, including the province of Cebu, where Marcos increased his vote share by over 20% compared to the 2016 presidential election.

##Unofficial tallies

Unofficial tallies were released by various groups, including the Parish Pastoral Council for Responsible Voting (PPCRV) and the National Movement for Free Elections (NAMFREL). These tallies showed Marcos and Duterte winning.

#Aftermath

##Election night

Election night saw a mixture of emotions, with supporters of Marcos and Duterte celebrating their victories, while supporters of Robredo and other candidates conceding defeat.

##Concessions

Robredo and several other candidates conceded defeat, congratulating Marcos and Duterte on their victories.

##Protests

There were several protests held by supporters of Robredo and other candidates, alleging irregularities in the election.

##International reactions

The international community congratulated Marcos and Duterte on their victories, with several countries, including the United States and China, releasing statements of congratulation.

article:
Public hearings of the United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack

The United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack held a series of public hearings from June 2022 to December 2022, investigating the January 6 United States Capitol attack and the events leading up to it. The committee, composed of seven Democrats and two Republicans, aimed to shed light on the circumstances surrounding the attack and the role of former President Donald Trump and his allies.

#Schedule

The committee held its first public hearing on June 9, 2022, and subsequent hearings took place on June 13, 16, 21, 23, 28, July 12, 21, October 13, and December 19, 2022.

#Background

The January 6 United States Capitol attack occurred on January 6, 2021, when a mob of supporters of then-President Donald Trump stormed the United States Capitol, disrupting the certification of the 2020 presidential election results. The attack resulted in five deaths, over 140 injuries, and significant damage to the Capitol building.

In the aftermath of the attack, the House of Representatives established the Select Committee on the January 6 Attack to investigate the circumstances leading up to the attack and the role of Trump and his allies. The committee, chaired by Representative Bennie Thompson, conducted extensive interviews, gathered documents, and held public hearings to shed light on the events surrounding the attack.

#Preliminary hearing – July 27, 2021

##Participants

The preliminary hearing featured testimony from four police officers who defended the Capitol during the January 6 attack: Harry Dunn, Aquilino Gonell, Michael Fanone, and Daniel Hodges.

##Synopsis of preliminary hearing

The hearing focused on the experiences of the police officers who defended the Capitol during the attack. The officers described the violence and chaos they faced, as well as the emotional trauma they suffered. The hearing aimed to set the tone for the committee's investigation and emphasize the importance of understanding the events surrounding the attack.

#First hearing – June 9, 2022 – Primetime

##Participants

The first hearing featured testimony from Nick Quested, a documentary filmmaker who followed the Proud Boys, a far-right extremist group, on January 6, and Caroline Edwards, a Capitol Police officer who was injured during the attack.

##Synopsis of first hearing

The hearing began with opening statements from the panel members, who emphasized the importance of the investigation and the need to hold those responsible for the attack accountable.

###Opening statements by the panel members

Representative Thompson emphasized the significance of the investigation, stating, "The Select Committee's work is not about partisan politics; it's about getting to the truth." Representative Liz Cheney added, "We will not be deterred by those who want to hide the truth or escape accountability."

###Trump knew that he lost

The hearing presented evidence that Trump knew he had lost the election, despite his claims of widespread voter fraud. The committee showed a video clip of Trump's former Attorney General, William Barr, stating that the Department of Justice found no evidence of widespread voter fraud.

###Rush to issue presidential pardons

The hearing revealed that Trump and his allies attempted to issue presidential pardons to those involved in the January 6 attack. The committee presented evidence of a draft pardon list that included several individuals who were later charged in connection with the attack.

###Attack on the Capitol

The hearing featured footage of the January 6 attack, including the storming of the Capitol building and the violence against police officers.

###Pence called for the National Guard

The hearing revealed that Vice President Mike Pence called for the deployment of the National Guard to quell the violence, despite Trump's initial reluctance.

#Second hearing – June 13, 2022

##Participants

The second hearing featured testimony from Bill Stepien, Trump's 2020 campaign manager, and Chris Stirewalt, a former Fox News editor.

##Synopsis of second hearing

The hearing focused on the role of Trump's campaign in promoting false claims of voter fraud and the subsequent pressure on state officials to overturn the election results.

###Witness testimony

Stepien testified that Trump's campaign knew they had lost the election, but Trump refused to accept the results. Stirewalt testified that Fox News called the election for Biden on election night, despite Trump's claims of victory.

###Subpoena and absence of Bill Stepien

Stepien was subpoenaed to testify, but his lawyer stated that he was unable to appear due to a family emergency. However, the committee later revealed that Stepien had been in touch with Trump's lawyers and had been advised not to testify.

###Knowledgeable insiders dismiss voter fraud allegations

The hearing presented evidence that several of Trump's closest advisors, including Barr and Stepien, had dismissed the allegations of widespread voter fraud.

###False claims appeared in Trump fundraising

The committee revealed that Trump's campaign continued to promote false claims of voter fraud in fundraising emails, despite knowing they were unsubstantiated.

#Third hearing – June 16, 2022

##Participants

The third hearing featured testimony from J. Michael Luttig, a former federal judge and advisor to Vice President Pence, and Greg Jacob, a lawyer who advised Pence on the electoral count.

##Synopsis of third hearing

The hearing focused on the role of Vice President Pence in the electoral count and the pressure he faced from Trump to overturn the election results.

###Experts testimony on the Constitutional role of the Vice President in the election

Luttig testified that the Vice President's role in the electoral count is ceremonial and that he does not have the authority to unilaterally reject electoral votes.

###Narrative of Vice President Pence and the events of January 6

The hearing presented a detailed narrative of Pence's actions on January 6, including his decision to reject Trump's pressure to overturn the election results.

###Luttig warns about 2024

Luttig warned that the events of January 6 could be repeated in the 2024 presidential election if Trump is not held accountable for his actions.

#Fourth hearing – June 21, 2022

##Participants

The fourth hearing featured testimony from Rusty Bowers, the Speaker of the Arizona House of Representatives, and Brad Raffensperger, the Georgia Secretary of State.

##Synopsis of fourth hearing

The hearing focused on the pressure Trump and his allies placed on state officials to overturn the election results.

###Trump calls the Georgia Secretary of State

The hearing revealed that Trump called Raffensperger and asked him to "find" enough votes to overturn the election results in Georgia.

###Surrogates pressured the Arizona House leadership

The hearing presented evidence that Trump's surrogates, including Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, pressured Bowers to overturn the election results in Arizona.

###Sean Riley "alternate electors" plan for Wisconsin and Michigan

The committee revealed a plan by Sean Riley, a Trump campaign official, to submit alternate electors in Wisconsin and Michigan, despite the fact that Biden had won both states.

###Impact of false fraud allegations on election workers

The hearing presented testimony from election workers who were subjected to harassment and intimidation due to false allegations of voter fraud.

###Reactions to fourth hearing

The hearing sparked widespread outrage, with many calling for Trump to be held accountable for his actions.

#Fifth hearing – June 23, 2022

##Participants

The fifth hearing featured testimony from Jeffrey Rosen, the former Acting Attorney General, and Richard Donoghue, the former Acting Deputy Attorney General.

##Synopsis of fifth hearing

The hearing focused on the pressure Trump placed on the Department of Justice to overturn the election results.

###"Just say it was corrupt"

The hearing revealed that Trump told Rosen and Donoghue to "just say it was corrupt" and leave the rest to him.

###Aborted attempt to install Jeffrey Clark as Attorney General

The committee revealed that Trump attempted to install Clark, a loyalist, as Attorney General, despite Rosen's objections.

###Request for preemptive pardons

The hearing presented evidence that Trump's allies requested preemptive pardons for themselves and others involved in the January 6 attack.

#Sixth hearing – June 28, 2022

##Participants

The sixth hearing featured testimony from Cassidy Hutchinson, a former aide to Mark Meadows, Trump's Chief of Staff.

##Synopsis of sixth hearing

The hearing focused on the events leading up to January 6 and the role of Trump's inner circle in promoting the violence.

###Prelude to January 6

The hearing presented evidence that Trump's inner circle knew about the potential for violence on January 6, but did nothing to stop it.

###Hutchinson account of January 6

Hutchinson testified that she witnessed Meadows and other Trump aides discussing the violence on January 6, but doing nothing to stop it.

###Immediate January 6 aftermath

The hearing presented evidence that Trump's inner circle was aware of the severity of the violence on January 6, but continued to downplay it.

###Rep. Cheney addresses possible tampering

Representative Cheney addressed the possibility that Trump's allies had tampered with witnesses, including Hutchinson.

###Reactions to sixth hearing

The hearing sparked widespread outrage, with many calling for Trump to be held accountable for his actions.

#Seventh hearing – July 12, 2022

##Participants

The seventh hearing featured testimony from Steve Bannon, a former Trump advisor, and others.

##Synopsis of seventh hearing

The hearing focused on the role of Bannon and other Trump allies in promoting the January 6 attack.

#Eighth hearing – July 21, 2022 – Primetime

##Participants

The eighth hearing featured testimony from Matthew Pottinger, a former National Security Council official, and others.

##Synopsis of eighth hearing

The hearing focused on the events leading up to January 6 and the role of Trump's inner circle in promoting the violence.

#Ninth hearing – October 13, 2022

##Participants

The ninth hearing featured testimony from several individuals, including former Trump aides.

##Synopsis of ninth hearing

The hearing focused on the events leading up to January 6 and the role of Trump's inner circle in promoting the violence.

###Prior to the ninth hearing

The committee announced that it would be holding a surprise hearing, citing new evidence.

###Aftermath of the ninth hearing

The hearing sparked widespread outrage, with many calling for Trump to be held accountable for his actions.

###Trump subpoena

The committee announced that it would be subpoenaing Trump to testify before the committee.

#Tenth hearing – December 19, 2022

##Participants

The tenth hearing featured testimony from several individuals, including former Trump aides.

##Synopsis of tenth hearing

The hearing focused on the events leading up to January 6 and the role of Trump's inner circle in promoting the violence.

#Media coverage

##June 9, 2022

###Fox News alternate coverage during hearing

Fox News chose to air its regular programming instead of covering the hearing live, sparking widespread criticism.

##July 21, 2022

The eighth hearing was widely covered by major news networks, including CNN, MSNBC, and ABC.

##Televised production and viewership

The hearings were produced for television and streamed online, with many outlets providing live coverage and analysis.

##Newspaper coverage

The hearings were widely covered by major newspapers, including The New York Times, The Washington Post, and The Wall Street Journal.

#See also

* January 6 United States Capitol attack
* United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack
* Donald Trump
* 2020 United States presidential election

#References

#External links

article:
DC Universe (franchise)
=======================

The DC Universe is a media franchise and shared universe created by DC Entertainment, a subsidiary of Warner Bros. Discovery. The franchise is centered on a series of interconnected films, television series, and video games based on characters from DC Comics. The DC Universe aims to create a cohesive and expansive narrative, exploring the vast array of characters and storylines from the DC Comics universe.

Background
-----------

### DC Extended Universe

The DC Universe is built upon the foundation of the DC Extended Universe (DCEU), a series of films that began with the release of Man of Steel in 2013. The DCEU aimed to create a shared universe of films, similar to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. However, after a series of underperforming films, including Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice and Justice League, Warner Bros. reevaluated its approach to the franchise.

### Warner Bros. Discovery

In 2021, Warner Bros. merged with Discovery, Inc. to form Warner Bros. Discovery. This merger led to a significant shift in the company's approach to its DC Comics properties. The new leadership, including CEO David Zaslav and DC Studios co-CEOs James Gunn and Peter Safran, announced plans to revamp the DC Universe and create a more cohesive and expansive franchise.

Development
------------

### DC Studios and initial developments

In 2022, Warner Bros. Discovery established DC Studios, a new subsidiary focused on developing and producing DC Comics-based content. James Gunn and Peter Safran were appointed as co-CEOs of DC Studios, tasked with overseeing the development of the DC Universe franchise.

Gunn and Safran announced plans to create a 10-year plan for the DC Universe, which would include a mix of films, television series, and video games. The duo emphasized the importance of creating a cohesive narrative across all platforms, while also allowing for creative freedom and experimentation.

### Chapter One: Gods and Monsters

In 2023, DC Studios announced the first phase of its 10-year plan, titled Chapter One: Gods and Monsters. This phase would focus on introducing core characters and storylines, laying the foundation for the larger DC Universe.

Chapter One would include a mix of films and television series, exploring the worlds of Superman, Batman, and other iconic DC characters. The phase would also introduce new characters and storylines, expanding the DC Universe in exciting and unexpected ways.

Films
------

### Superman (2025)

The first film in Chapter One is a new Superman film, scheduled for release in 2025. The film would reboot the Superman franchise, introducing a new take on the iconic character. Gunn and Safran have emphasized the importance of creating a more nuanced and complex Superman, exploring the character's humanity and vulnerability.

### Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow (2026)

A Supergirl film, titled Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow, is scheduled for release in 2026. The film would follow the adventures of Kara Zor-El, Superman's cousin, as she navigates the challenges of being a superhero.

### The Authority

A film based on the Wildstorm Comics series The Authority is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The film would explore the world of a team of superheroes who take a more extreme approach to justice.

### The Brave and the Bold

A film based on the comic book series The Brave and the Bold is in development, focusing on the team-up of Batman and the Demon. The film would explore the darker corners of the DC Universe, delving into the world of horror and the supernatural.

### Swamp Thing

A film based on the character of Swamp Thing is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The film would explore the world of the bayou, where the plant-like superhero must confront the forces of evil.

### Untitled Teen Titans film

A film based on the Teen Titans is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The film would explore the world of a team of young superheroes, as they navigate the challenges of being a hero.

### Untitled Bane and Deathstroke film

A film featuring the villains Bane and Deathstroke is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The film would explore the world of the DC Universe's most iconic villains, delving into their complex and nuanced characters.

Television series
-----------------

### Creature Commandos

A television series based on the Creature Commandos is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of a team of DC Universe monsters, including the Creature Commandos.

### Peacemaker season 2

A second season of the HBO Max series Peacemaker is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would continue to explore the world of the complex and nuanced character of Peacemaker.

### Lanterns

A television series based on the Green Lantern Corps is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of the intergalactic police force, delving into the complexities of the DC Universe.

### Waller

A television series based on the character of Amanda Waller is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of the complex and nuanced character of Waller, delving into her backstory and motivations.

### Paradise Lost

A television series based on the DC Universe's take on the story of Paradise Lost is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of the DC Universe's interpretation of the classic tale.

### Booster Gold

A television series based on the character of Booster Gold is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of the complex and nuanced character of Booster Gold, delving into his backstory and motivations.

### Untitled Blue Beetle series

A television series based on the character of Blue Beetle is in development, with Gunn and Safran overseeing the project. The series would explore the world of the complex and nuanced character of Blue Beetle, delving into his backstory and motivations.

Video games
------------

DC Studios is developing a range of video games, including a new Superman game and a game based on the Justice Society. The games would explore the world of the DC Universe, delving into the complexities and nuances of the characters and storylines.

Abandoned projects
-----------------

A range of projects were abandoned or put on hold during the development of the DC Universe franchise, including a film based on the character of Cyborg and a television series based on the character of Deadman.

DC Elseworlds
--------------

The DC Universe franchise includes a range of Elseworlds stories, which explore alternate takes on the DC Universe characters and storylines. These stories would be developed as films, television series, and video games, offering a fresh and exciting take on the DC Universe.

article:
The Chromatica Ball
=====================

The Chromatica Ball is a concert tour by American singer-songwriter Lady Gaga, in support of her sixth studio album, Chromatica (2020). The tour, which began on July 17, 2022, marks Gaga's return to touring after the COVID-19 pandemic and features a unique stage setup, elaborate costumes, and a set list that showcases her extensive discography.

Background and development
-------------------------

In May 2020, Lady Gaga released her sixth studio album, Chromatica, to critical acclaim. The album's themes of self-empowerment, love, and acceptance resonated with fans worldwide. Following the album's release, Gaga announced that a tour would be forthcoming, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, plans were put on hold. In March 2022, Gaga officially announced The Chromatica Ball tour, with dates scheduled in Europe, North America, and Asia.

Production
------------

### Conception and stage setup

The Chromatica Ball features a unique stage setup designed by Ric Lipinski and Lady Gaga's team. The stage is shaped like a giant orb, with a rotating platform that allows Gaga to perform from multiple angles. The setup also includes a series of interconnected catwalks, ramps, and staircases, creating an immersive experience for the audience. The stage is adorned with LED lights, lasers, and pyrotechnics, which are synchronized with the music and lighting design.

### Costume design

Lady Gaga's costumes for The Chromatica Ball were designed by a team of fashion designers, including Michael Schmidt, Nicola Formichetti, and Gaga herself. The costumes are a blend of futuristic and avant-garde styles, featuring intricate details, bold colors, and innovative materials. Each outfit is designed to reflect the theme and mood of the corresponding song, with some costumes featuring built-in LED lights, mirrors, and other special effects.

Concert synopsis
----------------

The Chromatica Ball concert features a set list of 24 songs, including hits from Gaga's discography, as well as some surprise covers and mashups. The show is divided into several acts, each with its own unique theme and aesthetic. The concert begins with a dramatic entrance, featuring Gaga rising from beneath the stage in a cloud of smoke and pyrotechnics. Throughout the show, Gaga interacts with her dancers, instrumentalists, and the audience, creating an energetic and engaging atmosphere.

Critical reception
-------------------

### Europe

The Chromatica Ball received widespread critical acclaim in Europe, with many reviewers praising Gaga's vocal performances, stage presence, and the tour's production values. The Guardian described the show as "a dazzling spectacle" with "Gaga at her most confident and charismatic." The Times praised the tour's "sheer scale and ambition," noting that "Gaga's voice is as strong as ever."

### North America

In North America, The Chromatica Ball was met with similar enthusiasm from critics. Rolling Stone described the show as "a stunning display of pop theatrics" with "Gaga delivering a performance that's both deeply personal and grandly entertaining." First Period Houses in Massachusetts (1660–1679)

First Period houses in Massachusetts refer to the oldest surviving homes in the state, built between 1660 and 1679. This period saw significant growth and development in Massachusetts, particularly in the Boston area, where many of these historic houses can still be found. The architecture of these homes reflects the skills and traditions of English craftsmen, who brought their expertise to the New World.

## Legend

The term "First Period" was coined by architectural historian Abbott Lowell Cummings to describe the earliest surviving homes in Massachusetts. Cummings, who wrote extensively on the subject, defined the First Period as spanning from 1626 to 1725. However, for the purposes of this article, we will focus on the specific sub-period between 1660 and 1679.

## 1660–1670

During this decade, Massachusetts experienced significant growth, driven by an influx of settlers from England. Many of these newcomers were skilled craftsmen, who brought with them the latest architectural styles and techniques. First Period houses from this era are characterized by their use of traditional English building methods, such as timber framing and wattle and daub construction.

One notable example from this period is the Parson Capen House, built in 1683 in Topsfield, Massachusetts. Although it was constructed slightly outside our specified timeframe, it is often cited as a prime example of First Period architecture. The house features a typical English-style timber frame, with a central chimney and a steeply pitched roof.

Other notable houses from this era include the Fairbanks House in Dedham, Massachusetts, and the Browne House in Watertown, Massachusetts. Both of these homes showcase the characteristic features of First Period architecture, including their use of timber framing, wattle and daub infill, and steeply pitched roofs.

## 1671–1679

The latter part of the 1670s saw continued growth and development in Massachusetts, particularly in the Boston area. During this period, many First Period houses were built in the city and its surrounding suburbs.

One notable example from this era is the Paul Revere House, built in 1680 in Boston's North End. Although it was constructed slightly outside our specified timeframe, it is often cited as a prime example of First Period architecture. The house features a typical English-style timber frame, with a central chimney and a steeply pitched roof.

Other notable houses from this era include the Pierce House in Dorchester, Massachusetts, and the James Blake House in Boston, Massachusetts. Both of these homes showcase the characteristic features of First Period architecture, including their use of timber framing, wattle and daub infill, and steeply pitched roofs.

Sarkaru Vaari Paata is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language action drama film written and directed by Parasuram. The film stars Mahesh Babu and Keerthy Suresh in lead roles, with music composed by S. Thaman. The film was released theatrically on 12 May 2022 and received mixed reviews from critics.

However, their relationship takes a complicated turn when Mahesh discovers that Kalaavathi is actually the daughter of a powerful politician who has been involved in several scandals. Mahesh soon finds himself in a web of politics and corruption, where he must use his wits and cunning to survive.

Filming wrapped up in April 2022, with the crew moving on to post-production work.

The film's score was also composed by S. Thaman, with the music receiving positive reviews from critics.

Wye, Kent
================

Wye is a village and civil parish in the Ashford district of Kent, England. It is situated approximately 12 miles (19 km) south of Canterbury and 5 miles (8 km) north of Ashford. The village has a rich history, dating back to the Iron Age, and is known for its picturesque landscape, historic buildings, and strong community spirit.

History
--------

### RAF Wye

During World War II, Wye was home to a Royal Air Force (RAF) base, which was established in 1943. The base was used as a satellite airfield for the nearby RAF Detling and was primarily used for training and refueling purposes. The airfield was decommissioned in 1946 and has since been returned to agricultural use.

### Wye Racecourse

Wye was also home to a horse racing track, which was established in the 19th century. The track was known for its challenging terrain and hosted several high-profile racing events, including the Wye Steeplechase. The track was closed in the 1970s due to financial difficulties and has since been redeveloped for housing.

Wye Court is a historic house that dates back to the 16th century. The house was built for the Thornhill family and has been extensively modified over the centuries. It is now a private residence and is not open to the public.

### Wye College

Wye College was a agricultural college that was established in 1894. The college was known for its innovative approaches to agriculture and was a major center for research and development. The college was closed in 2009 due to financial difficulties and has since been redeveloped for housing.

### Imperial College scheme

In 2015, Imperial College London announced plans to develop a new campus in Wye, which would focus on science and technology research. The scheme was met with opposition from local residents and was eventually scrapped due to concerns over the impact on the local environment.

Raquel Welch

Raquel Welch is a legendary American actress, singer, and sex symbol who rose to international stardom in the 1960s and 1970s. With a career spanning over five decades, Welch has established herself as one of the most iconic and enduring figures in Hollywood history.

# Early life

Jo Raquel Tejada was born on September 5, 1940, in Chicago, Illinois, to Armando Tejada, a Bolivian immigrant, and Josephine Sarah Hall, an American of English and Irish ancestry. Welch's parents divorced when she was a toddler, and she was raised by her mother in San Diego, California. She began taking ballet lessons at the age of seven and later attended La Jolla High School, where she was an active member of the school's drama department.

# Career

## 1964–1966: Early works and breakthrough

Welch began her career as a weather forecaster at a local San Diego television station, eventually moving to Los Angeles to pursue a career in acting. She made her film debut in 1964 with a small role in the Elvis Presley film "Roustabout." Her breakthrough came in 1966 when she landed the starring role in the science fiction film "One Million Years B.C.," which showcased her stunning physical appearance and catapulted her to international fame.

## 1967–1979: International stardom

Throughout the late 1960s and 1970s, Welch became a household name, starring in a string of successful films, including "Fathom" (1967), "Bedazzled" (1967), "Bandolero!" (1968), and "100 Rifles" (1969). Her iconic roles in these films cemented her status as a sex symbol and earned her the nickname "the most desired woman in the world."

## 1980–2017: Subsequent projects and later years

In the 1980s, Welch began to focus on more dramatic roles, appearing in films such as "Cannery Row" (1982) and "Right to Die" (1987). She also made numerous television appearances, including a starring role in the sitcom "The Marilyn McCoo and Billy Davis Jr. Show" (1977) and a guest spot on the popular series "Seinfeld" (1995).

# Achievements and awards

Throughout her career, Welch has received numerous awards and accolades, including a Golden Globe Award for New Star of the Year in 1967 and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1994.

# Beauty and business career

In addition to her acting career, Welch has launched a range of beauty and wellness products, including a line of wigs and hair care products.

# Personal life

## Marriages and relationships

Welch has been married four times: to James Welch (1959–1964), Patrick Curtis (1967–1972), André Weinfeld (1980–1990), and Richard Palmer (1999–2017).

## Religion

## Point distribution

Great Britain and Northern Ireland at the 2022 European Championships

The 2022 European Championships, a multi-sport event, took place in Munich, Germany, from August 11 to August 21, 2022. article:
Threads (social network)

Threads is a social media app developed by Instagram, a subsidiary of Meta Platforms, Inc. The app allows users to share text posts, similar to Twitter, and is integrated with Instagram. Threads was launched in July 2023, amidst a crowded social media landscape, and has faced various challenges and controversies.

# History

## Predecessor

Threads is not the first attempt by Instagram to create a text-based social media platform. In 2019, Instagram launched a feature called "Threads" which allowed users to share photos and videos with close friends. However, this feature was eventually shut down due to low usage.

## Development and announcement

In 2022, Instagram began developing a new social media app, codenamed "Project 92". The app was designed to be a text-based platform, allowing users to share short posts, similar to Twitter. In June 2023, Instagram officially announced the app, now called Threads, and revealed that it would be integrated with Instagram.

## Launch

Threads was launched on July 5, 2023, for both iOS and Android devices. The app was available in over 100 countries, and users could sign up using their Instagram account. Upon launch, Threads faced technical issues, including slow loading times and errors.

# Appearance and features

Threads has a simple and minimalistic design, with a focus on text-based posts. The app allows users to share posts of up to 500 characters, and supports basic formatting options, such as bold and italics. Users can also share links, images, and videos.

## Possibility of open interoperability

Threads has sparked debate about the possibility of open interoperability between social media platforms. Some experts have argued that Threads could be a step towards a more open and decentralized social media ecosystem, where users can seamlessly interact with other platforms.

## Account integration with Instagram

Threads is deeply integrated with Instagram, and users can sign up using their Instagram account. This integration allows users to share posts from Threads to Instagram, and also enables features like account verification and login.

## Device compatibility

Threads is available on both iOS and Android devices, and can be accessed through the app or through the Instagram website.

## Censorship attempts

Threads has faced censorship attempts from various governments and organizations. In some countries, the app has been blocked or restricted, citing concerns over misinformation and hate speech.

## Advertising

Threads does not currently display ads, but Instagram has announced plans to introduce advertising on the platform in the future.

# Userbase

## Decline in the months after launch

After a successful launch, Threads' userbase declined in the following months. According to reports, the app's daily active users decreased by over 50% in the first few months after launch.

## Popularity in Taiwan

Despite declining user numbers globally, Threads has gained popularity in Taiwan. The app has become a popular platform for Taiwanese users to discuss politics and social issues.

# Responses

## Intellectual property dispute

Threads has been involved in an intellectual property dispute with a company called "Threads, Inc.", which claims that Instagram's app infringes on their trademark.

## Data privacy

Threads has faced concerns over data privacy, with some experts arguing that the app's integration with Instagram raises concerns about user data being shared between platforms.

## State media

State media outlets have responded to Threads with skepticism, with some outlets accusing the app of spreading misinformation and propaganda.

## Imitating other platforms

Threads has been accused of imitating other social media platforms, such as Twitter and Mastodon. Some experts have argued that the app's features and design are too similar to existing platforms.

# See also

* Instagram
* Twitter
* Mastodon
* Social media
* Online communities

article:
The Super Mario Bros. Movie
==========================

The Super Mario Bros. Movie is an upcoming computer-animated adventure comedy film based on the popular Super Mario video game franchise. The film is produced by Illumination and Nintendo, and is scheduled for release in 2023.

Plot
-----

The Super Mario Bros. Movie follows the story of Mario, a plumber who lives in the Mushroom Kingdom, a fantastical world filled with strange creatures, pipes, and power-ups. When Mario's brother, Luigi, is kidnapped by the evil Bowser, Mario sets out on a quest to rescue him. Along the way, he teams up with Princess Peach and other characters from the Mario universe, including Toad and Yoshi.

As Mario navigates the Mushroom Kingdom, he must use his wits and skills to overcome obstacles and defeat enemies. The film features a mix of action, comedy, and heart, and is designed to appeal to both fans of the video game series and newcomers alike.

Voice Cast
------------

The Super Mario Bros. Movie features an all-star voice cast, including:

* Chris Pratt as Mario
* Charlie Day as Luigi
* Anya Taylor-Joy as Princess Peach
* Jack Black as Bowser
* Seth Rogen as Donkey Kong
* Keegan-Michael Key as Toad
* Fred Armisen as Cranky Kong

Production
------------

### Development

The Super Mario Bros. Movie was first announced in 2018, when Illumination and Nintendo revealed that they were partnering to produce a film based on the popular video game franchise. The film was initially scheduled for release in 2022, but was later pushed back to 2023.

### Writing

The screenplay for The Super Mario Bros. Movie was written by Matthew Fogel, who is best known for his work on the Illumination film Minions. The script was developed in collaboration with Nintendo, and is designed to stay true to the spirit of the video game series.

### Casting

The voice cast for The Super Mario Bros. Movie was announced in 2020, with Chris Pratt and Charlie Day revealed as the leads. The casting process was overseen by Illumination and Nintendo, who worked together to select a talented group of actors to bring the characters to life.

### Animation and Design

The animation for The Super Mario Bros. Movie was produced by Illumination, which is known for its work on films like Despicable Me and Minions. The film features a mix of computer-generated imagery and traditional animation techniques, and is designed to bring the Mushroom Kingdom to life in a way that is both faithful to the video game series and visually stunning.

### Music

The music for The Super Mario Bros. Movie was composed by Brian Tyler, who is best known for his work on films like Iron Man 3 and Thor: The Dark World. The score features a mix of original music and classic themes from the Mario video game series, and is designed to add depth and emotion to the film.

Marketing
----------

The marketing campaign for The Super Mario Bros. Movie was launched in 2022, with a series of trailers and promotional images released online. The campaign is designed to appeal to both fans of the video game series and newcomers alike, and features a mix of action, comedy, and heart.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

The Super Mario Bros. Movie is scheduled for release in theaters on April 7, 2023. The film will be distributed by Universal Pictures, which has a long-standing partnership with Illumination.

### Home Media

The Super Mario Bros. Movie will be available on home media platforms, including DVD, Blu-ray, and digital download, later in 2023. The home media release will feature a range of bonus features, including deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes footage, and making-of documentaries.

### Internet Leak

In February 2023, a leaked version of The Super Mario Bros. Movie was posted online, sparking widespread discussion and debate among fans. The leak was quickly taken down by Universal Pictures, which has since increased security measures to prevent further leaks.

Reception
----------

### Box Office

#### Domestic

The Super Mario Bros. Movie is expected to perform strongly at the domestic box office, with many analysts predicting a opening weekend gross of over $50 million.

#### Other Territories

The film is also expected to perform well in other territories, including Europe and Asia, where the Mario video game series is extremely popular.

### Critical Response

The critical response to The Super Mario Bros. Movie has been largely positive, with many reviewers praising the film's visuals, humor, and faithfulness to the video game series.

### Accolades

The Super Mario Bros. Movie has received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Animated Feature at the 2023 Golden Globe Awards.

Future
--------

### Sequel

A sequel to The Super Mario Bros. Movie has been announced, with Illumination and Nintendo set to partner once again to produce a new film based on the popular video game franchise.

### Possible Spin-Offs

There have been rumors of possible spin-offs, including a film based on the character of Luigi and a television series featuring the characters from the Mario universe.
